page.title: 12Borley Rectory
page.content:
BORLEY RECTORY In 1956, the Society for Psychical Research called this building the most haunted house in Britain. The first people to have un- usual experiences were Rev.Henry Bull and his son Rev.Harry Bull. The latter saw a ghostly nun, spectral coach,a headless man and a ghostly retainer. During the time of Rev.G.E.Smith, from 1928-30, an investigation was begun by the Daily Mirror. They sent Harry Price who claimed footsteps,poltergeists etc. In the Thirties, Marianne Foyster, the Rector's wife found messages written on the walls and experienced poltergeist actions. Even today local people tell stories of strange happenings at Borley
By: Children of Woodhall School.
